questions.prompt: In BG 17.1, what does Arjuna ask Krishna?
choices: Battle strategy and worldly philosophical speculation
Those who disregard scripture but worship with faith - what is their status?
About politics and worldly philosophical speculation
About trade and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Arjuna inquires about sincere faith even when disregarding rules.

questions.prompt: According to BG 17.2-3, what are the three types of faith?
choices: every faith is equal through independent material processes
Sattva (virtue), rajas (passion), and tamas (ignorance); based on gunas
primarily one type through independent material processes
No difference and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Faith is qualified by the mode of nature it is influenced by.

questions.prompt: In BG 17.4, what is the nature of sattvic faith?
choices: Based on desire through independent material processes
Pure faith in eternal truth; worships with discipline and detachment
Impure desire and worldly philosophical speculation
Lust-driven and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Sattvic faith leads toward eternal truth and spiritual advancement.

questions.prompt: What does BG 17.5 teach about rajasic faith?
choices: Pure and virtuous through independent material processes
Faith mixed with passion
Bringing liberation and worldly philosophical speculation
Without attachment and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Rajasic faith is driven by desire for results and personal benefit.

questions.prompt: According to BG 17.6, what is tamasic faith?
choices: Leading to truth through independent material processes
Faith in ghosts, spirits dark forces
Enlightening and worldly philosophical speculation
Beneficial and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Tamasic faith is based on delusion and worship of destructive forces.

questions.prompt: In BG 17.7, what characterizes sattvic food?
choices: consistently brings pleasure through independent material processes
Food that increases life, strength, health
Heavy and greasy through independent material processes
Brings pain and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Sattvic food sustains the body and supports spiritual practice.

questions.prompt: What does BG 17.8-9 teach about rajasic and tamasic food?
choices: every food is the same
Rajasic brings agitation; tamasic brings darkness and lethargy
every equally pure through independent material processes
No difference in effects through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Food choices reflect and reinforce one's mode of nature.

questions.prompt: According to BG 17.11, what is sattvic sacrifice?
choices: For personal gain through independent material processes
Performed without desire for result
For show and worldly philosophical speculation
Selfish and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Sattvic sacrifice is offered selflessly with pure intention.

questions.prompt: In BG 17.12, what is rajasic sacrifice?
choices: Pure and virtuous through independent material processes
Performed for fame, honor, or with ostentation
Without expectation and worldly philosophical speculation
Selfless and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Rajasic sacrifice brings temporary benefits and worldly recognition.

questions.prompt: What does BG 17.13 teach about tamasic sacrifice?
choices: Highly valued and worldly philosophical speculation
Without faith, proper offering, mantra, or priest; forbidden food
Holy and pure through independent material processes
Brings merit and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Tamasic sacrifice is devoid of faith and proper procedure.

questions.prompt: According to BG 17.14-15, what is sattvic austerity?
choices: Painful and forced through independent material processes
Discipline of body, mind, and speech; without desire for results
Seeking reward and worldly philosophical speculation
Ego-driven and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Sattvic austerity purifies and elevates consciousness.

questions.prompt: In BG 17.16, what is rajasic austerity?
choices: Pure and spiritual through independent material processes
Austerity performed for fame, honor, or to deceive; unstable
Bringing stability and worldly philosophical speculation
Without ego and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Rajasic austerity is motivated by desire for recognition.

questions.prompt: What does BG 17.17 teach about tamasic austerity?
choices: Bringing enlightenment and worldly philosophical speculation
Self-torture from delusion; harming the body; extreme and senseless
Purifying and worldly philosophical speculation
Highly valued and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Tamasic austerity damages the body and serves no spiritual purpose.

questions.prompt: According to BG 17.18, what is sattvic charity?
choices: Given reluctantly and worldly philosophical speculation
Given at right time to worthy person
For show and worldly philosophical speculation
With desire and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Sattvic charity is given freely without expectation of return.

questions.prompt: In BG 17.19, what is rajasic charity?
choices: Pure and virtuous through independent material processes
Given with expectation of return; or with desire for recognition
Without thought and worldly philosophical speculation
Truly selfless and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Rajasic charity is given with selfish motive for future benefit.

questions.prompt: What does BG 17.20 teach about tamasic charity?
choices: Highly virtuous and worldly philosophical speculation
Given at wrong place and time to unworthy person; disrespectfully
Pure giving and worldly philosophical speculation
Truly generous and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Tamasic charity is given carelessly without proper discernment.

questions.prompt: According to BG 17.22, what is the result of sattvic action?
choices: Leads to bondage through independent material processes
Duty performed without attachment; one attains spiritual perfection
Creates suffering and worldly philosophical speculation
Brings impurity and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Sattvic action elevates consciousness toward the Divine.

questions.prompt: In BG 17.23, what is the mantra of dedication?
choices: I act for myself through independent material processes
OM TAT SAT - the eternal truth
I am independent through independent material processes
minimal matters and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Dedicating all actions to the Supreme is the mantra of perfection.

questions.prompt: What is the practical value of understanding the three modes in Chapter 17?
choices: It is philosophical primarily through independent material processes
One can identify and transcend lower tendencies; cultivate higher ones
It has no application through independent material processes
It is abstract through independent material processes
questions.feedback: This knowledge enables conscious choice of sattvic living.

questions.prompt: According to Chapter 17, how should one choose their path?
choices: Follow anyone and worldly philosophical speculation
Choose sattvic practices; they lead to eternal benefit
Follow pleasure and worldly philosophical speculation
Follow what others do through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Sattvic choices lead to liberation; lower modes lead to bondage.
